Name: TIPERs: Sensemaking Tasks for Introductory Physics (Pearson Series in Educational Innovation: Student Resources for Physics)

ReviewList.Text: Excellent opportunity to use as a formative assessment tool for high school physics teachers. The students MUST think and back up their answer with the reasons why.

This is a fantastic book to get students thinking about the physics topics in new and challenging ways.  A must have for the AP Physics 1 and AP Physics 2 teacher, as these are the reasoning tasks that will help stdents better prepare for the types of questions they will see on the new exam.

Love this book!!  Tons of great questions to use with kids and they are all higher level but best of all, most topics have multiple questions with increasing content difficulty so the scaffolding is done for you.
Great book.  Ideal for teaching physics.  Gets students focused and thinking on various aspects of the curriculum.
One of the best tools for teaching Physics.
